fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Communication
eu_initiatives: Università Iuav di Venezia is interested and involved into several EU Programs as: H2020, LIFE+, ERASMUS+, ERASMUS MUNDUS, Creative Europe, INTERREG.
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
position: Dirigente Area ricerca, sistema bibliotecario e dei laboratori
relevant_communication: Università Iuav di Venezia organises cultural and scientific events.  Since 2011, it has been awarded with 62 grants in the frame of individual and collaborative Italian, European and International projects on various topics. IUAV is leader in Erasmus consortia such as LLP Intensive Programmes, Erasmus Mundus and Placement, partner of Tempus, Strategic Partnership, Capacity Building and Erasmus for Young Entrepreneurs projects.
goals__remit:
One of the first Architecture Schools in Italy (established in 1926), the Università Iuav di Venezia is a ‘themed’ university totally focusing on design. 
It is a dedicated place for teaching and research in: design of living space and environments (such as buildings, cities, landscapes, regions)  as well as design of every-day use objects, cultural, theatrical, multimedia events, fashion and graphics.  
The Università Iuav di Venezia is organised into three departments: “Architecture, Construction and Conservation”, "Design and Planning in Complex Environments”, "Architecture and Arts". 
 
Educational programmes, courses and activities are divided into  undergraduate degree programmes (5), graduate degree programmes (7), PHD and master programmes. 
 
All educational programme provide workshops for experiencing and learning under the direct guidance of high-calibre professionals and professors in the practice and design teaching fields and some courses are in English. 
 
Research activities are focused on: city, region and environment, landscape, infrastructure and mobility, protection and conservation, sustainable design, history of architecture, the new frontiers of design, arts and theatre.
